name: stuffer
content:
stuffer noun [C]
(PERSON/DEVICE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who stuffs (= fills) things , especially as their job: He got a job as a tennis ball stuffer. She started out at the BBC as part-time stuffer of mail order envelopes.
a device used for stuffing (= filling) something : Sausage stuffers are used to stuff sausage or other meats in a casing.

stuffer noun [C]
(ADVERTISING)
US a piece of printed advertising, often one that is put in an envelope together with a letter, bill, etc.: Financial services providers often include these stuffers along with their monthly account statements. The glossy leaflet looked better than your usual mailbox stuffers. There are predesigned templates for counter cards, fliers, and stuffers.
